content:
create answer key for final exam:

break down week one into action items, resources and requirements. create final exam questions to pass into: Week 1: Introduction to UX

Introduction to UX design principles and processes
Overview of UX design tools and software
Reading: "Don't Make Me Think" by Steve Krug

Week 1: Introduction to UX

Action items:

Read "Don't Make Me Think" by Steve Krug
Research and explore UX design principles and processes
Familiarize yourself with UX design tools and software
Resources:

"Don't Make Me Think" by Steve Krug (book)
"A Comprehensive Guide to UX Design" by Adobe (article)
"The Beginner's Guide to UX Design" by UX Design (article)
"The Ultimate Guide to UX Design" by CareerFoundry (article)
"UX Design Fundamentals" by Springboard (course)
"UX Design for Beginners" by Udemy (course)
Requirements:

Access to the internet and a computer/laptop
Willingness to learn and explore new concepts
Time commitment to read, research, and familiarize oneself with UX design principles and processes
Final exam questions:

What are some key principles of UX design?
Name at least three UX design tools and software.
What is the main takeaway from "Don't Make Me Think" by Steve Krug?
Describe the UX design process and the key stages involved.
How would you apply UX design principles to improve the user experience of a website or mobile app?
